definition: to be determined to win (idiom)
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
certainly/must/will/necessarily
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: Barriss said to let him help you strive for more, and all she is.
sentences.chinese: 芭丽说想让他帮自己争取更多，而且她是势在必得。

sentences.english: We have got two home games coming up in the Premier League and we need to make them count.
sentences.chinese: 接下来有两个联赛的主场比赛，我们势在必得。

definition: to come prepared
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
to stake all on one throw
to covet/to long for/to lust after
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat/to burn one's boats
unalterable/certainly/definitely
everything bodes ill, no positive signs (idiom); inauspicious/everything points to disaster
win or lose, it all ends here/this is the moment to shine
pinyin: cheng2 bai4 zai4 ci3 yi1 ju3

definition: to succeed or die trying (idiom)
pinyin: bu4 cheng2 gong1 bian4 cheng2 ren2

definition: to fight to one's last gasp
to put one's all into the fight
the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
to spare no effort/to devote all one's energies
to upset the apple cart/to disrupt things
to take on (a responsibility)
